subject: Re: [junit] which jdk will work with JUnit on Redhat6.2?
msgSnippet: ... There were two kinds of errors in the trace. One was from the ClassLoader (which is different in 3.4 than earlier revs) and could be environmental. My
messageBody:
--- Joi Ellis <joi@...> wrote:
>I noticed the error you're getting, and I don't see how that can be
>blamed upon the JVM.

There were two kinds of errors in the trace. One was from the
ClassLoader (which is different in 3.4 than earlier revs) and could be
environmental. My suggestion: disable the class loader using the
excluded.properties.

The other two errors were bad returns that look just like the result of
a bug in the current Linux JVM from Sun. JVM bugs do not necessarily
cause crashes. This is a known bug at java.sun.com.

Regards,

Rob
